intro: Styphelia vannouhuysii, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the Western Cape region of South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many heath and heather plants, and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, needle-like leaves and produces delicate, bell-shaped white or pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation. Styphelia vannouhuysii is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat, with drought-resistant properties and a slow growth rate.
